org.jcvi.jillion.assembly

Interface ScaffoldBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<Scaffold>

    public interface ScaffoldBuilder
extends Builder<Scaffold>
    ScaffoldBuilder is a Builder that builds a single Scaffold. All contigs added to this scaffold need to use the same reference/ scaffold coordinate space so they can be aligned to each other correctly.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      • add

        ScaffoldBuilder add(PlacedContig placedContig)
        Add the given PlacedContig to the Scaffold being built.
        Parameters:
        placedContig - the placedContig to add can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if placedContig is null.

      • add

        ScaffoldBuilder add(String contigId,
                    Range contigRange,
                    Direction contigDirection)
        Add the given contig to the Scaffold being built at the given range in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        contigId - the id of the contig, must be unique to this Scaffold; can not be null.
        contigRange - the Range that this contig aligns to on the scaffold; can not be null.
        contigDirection - the Direction of this contig relative to the Scaffold.
        Returns:
        this;

      • add

        ScaffoldBuilder add(String contigId,
                    Range contigRange)
        Convenience method for adding a contig in the forward direction. This is the same as add(contigId, contigRange, Direction.FORWARD)
        Parameters:
        contigId - the id of the contig, must be unique to this Scaffold; can not be null.
        contigRange - the Range that this contig aligns to on the scaffold; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        add(String, Range, Direction)

      • add

        ScaffoldBuilder add(String contigId,
                    DirectedRange contigRange)
        Convenience method for adding a contig in the forward direction. This is the same as add(contigId, contigRange.getRange(), contigRange.getDirection()).
        Parameters:
        contigId - the id of the contig, must be unique to this Scaffold; can not be null.
        contigRange - the DirectedRange that this contig aligns to on the scaffold; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        add(String, Range, Direction)

      • shiftContigsToOrigin

        ScaffoldBuilder shiftContigsToOrigin(boolean shiftContigs)
        Shift all contigs in the scaffold so that the first contig will start at the scaffold origin (offset 0). The distances between contigs will not change, only the actual begin and end locations.

        The actual coordinate conversion will occur at built time during the build() method. This means that the shift flag can be switched on or off many times without affecting any of the contig coordinates (until the Scaffold is built).

        Parameters:
        shiftContigs - true to shift the contigs to the origin; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        this

      • build

        Scaffold build()
        Create a new Scaffold object using the all the given contigs so far. Create a new instance using the data collected by this builder thus far.
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<Scaffold>
        Returns:
        a new instance of T.
